slides.title: Welcome to CMA Foundation
slides.content:
# CMA India Foundation Level

Foundation covers the **basics** for cost and management accounting.

## What You Will Learn

- **Accounting** - Fundamentals
- **Law** - Business and commercial
- **Economics** - Micro and macro
- **Mathematics** - Business calculations

## Foundation Papers

| Paper | Subject |
|-------|--------|
| 1 | Fundamentals of Economics |
| 2 | Fundamentals of Accounting |
| 3 | Fundamentals of Laws |
| 4 | Business Mathematics |

slides.title: Accounting Fundamentals
slides.content:
# Basics of Accounting

## Accounting Equation

```
Assets = Liabilities + Equity
```

## Types of Accounts

| Type | Examples |
|------|----------|
| Personal | Debtors, creditors |
| Real | Assets |
| Nominal | Income, expenses |

## Golden Rules

| Account | Debit | Credit |
|---------|-------|--------|
| Personal | Receiver | Giver |
| Real | What comes in | What goes out |
| Nominal | Expenses/losses | Income/gains |

slides.title: Journal and Ledger
slides.content:
# Recording Transactions

## Journal Entry

```
Date | Particulars | Debit | Credit
-----|-------------|-------|--------
```

## Posting to Ledger

```
Account Name
-----------------------
Debit Side | Credit Side
-----------------------
```

## Trial Balance

```
All debit balances
= All credit balances

Checks arithmetic accuracy
```

## Accounting Cycle

1. Journal entries
2. Post to ledger
3. Trial balance
4. Financial statements

slides.title: Accounting Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: The accounting equation is Assets = Liabilities +?

slides.title: Financial Statements
slides.content:
# Final Accounts

## Trading Account

```
Opening Stock + Purchases - Closing Stock
= Cost of Goods Sold

Sales - COGS = Gross Profit
```

## Profit and Loss Account

```
Gross Profit
- Operating Expenses
= Net Profit
```

## Balance Sheet

| Assets | Liabilities + Equity |
|--------|----------------------|
| Fixed assets | Capital |
| Current assets | Long-term liabilities |
| | Current liabilities |

slides.title: Business Economics
slides.content:
# Microeconomics

## Demand and Supply

| Concept | Relationship |
|---------|--------------|
| Demand | Price up, quantity down |
| Supply | Price up, quantity up |
| Equilibrium | Demand = Supply |

## Elasticity

```
Price Elasticity = % Change in Qty / % Change in Price

Elastic: > 1
Inelastic: < 1
Unitary: = 1
```

## Market Structures

| Structure | Sellers | Price |
|-----------|---------|-------|
| Monopoly | One | Price maker |
| Oligopoly | Few | Price leader |
| Competition | Many | Price taker |

slides.title: Macroeconomics
slides.content:
# National Economy

## GDP Calculation

```
Expenditure Method:
GDP = C + I + G + (X - M)

C = Consumption
I = Investment
G = Government
X - M = Net exports
```

## Economic Concepts

| Concept | Meaning |
|---------|--------|
| Inflation | Price rise |
| Deflation | Price fall |
| Stagflation | Inflation + stagnation |

## Monetary Policy

- Repo rate
- Bank rate
- CRR
- SLR

slides.title: Business Mathematics
slides.content:
# Mathematical Foundations

## Ratio and Proportion

```
Ratio = a : b
Proportion = a : b :: c : d
```

## Percentage

```
Percentage = (Part / Whole) x 100

Increase % = (Increase / Original) x 100
```

## Simple Interest

```
SI = P x R x T / 100

P = Principal
R = Rate
T = Time
```

## Compound Interest

```
A = P(1 + R/100)^n

CI = A - P
```

slides.quizQuestion: Simple Interest formula is P x R x T divided by?

slides.title: Statistics Basics
slides.content:
# Statistical Methods

## Measures of Central Tendency

| Measure | Formula |
|---------|--------|
| Mean | Sum of values / Count |
| Median | Middle value |
| Mode | Most frequent |

## Measures of Dispersion

| Measure | Shows |
|---------|-------|
| Range | Max - Min |
| Variance | Spread from mean |
| Std deviation | Square root of variance |

## Correlation

```
r = +1: Perfect positive
r = 0: No correlation
r = -1: Perfect negative
```

slides.title: Time Value of Money
slides.content:
# TVM Concepts

## Present Value

```
PV = FV / (1 + r)^n
```

## Future Value

```
FV = PV x (1 + r)^n
```

## Annuity

| Type | Payments |
|------|----------|
| Ordinary | End of period |
| Due | Beginning of period |

## Applications

- Loan calculations
- Investment decisions
- Retirement planning
